title: How to use Grok Imagine to create amazing images and videos, explains Elon Musk
snippet: On Saturday, Elon Musk shared how users can create cinematic images and videos with xAI’s Grok Imagine. By using detailed, emotion driven prompts and filmmaking terms, the AI tool can deliver more dramatic, story rich visuals on X. Here is a complete guide on AI prompts to get better results.

title: Heard of digital beggars? When a UPI code turns into a livestream tip jar
snippet: Experts warn that unlike regulated platforms such as YouTube, QR-code donations lack safeguards, making them vulnerable to scams. Fraudsters can use fake QR codes to steal UPI PINs or install spyware.

title: Motorola may finally take on Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 with a notebook-style foldable in 2026: here's what we know
snippet: Motorola may launch its first notebook-style foldable device, the razr fold, in 2026. The phone would compete directly with Samsung Z Fold 7.

title: ‘We will be outcompeted’: Leading AI expert warns world may be running out of time to prepare for AI risks
snippet: AI safety expert David Dalrymple warns that rapid AI development may outpace safety measures. He says this could be risking destabilization of security and economy &nbsp;and emphasized the need for better control of advanced AI systems

title: Redmi Note 15 5G India launch roundup: Launch date, expected price, specifications and more
snippet: Redmi Note 15 5G will launch in India on January 6 with a 6.77-inch AMOLED display, Snapdragon 6 Gen 3 processor, and a 5,520mAh battery. It is expected to be priced around  ₹20,000 and compete with OnePlus Nord CE 5 and Realme P4 Pro.

title: Oppo Reno 15 Pro Mini vs OnePlus 13s: Which compact flagship could woo you in 2026? Check full comparison
snippet: The Oppo Reno 15 Pro Mini is set to debut on January 8 and will take on the OnePlus 13s. It may offer a superior camera and battery but feature a less powerful MediaTek processor.&nbsp;

title: Oppo Reno 15 series set to debut in India on 8 January: Expected price, specifications and more
snippet: Oppo will launch its Reno 15 series in India on January 8, featuring three models: Reno 15 Pro 5G, Reno 15 Pro Mini 5G, and Reno 15 5G. Ahead of the launch, Oppo has also confirmed some of the key specifications of the Oppo Reno 15 lineup.

title: Android users can now identify scam messages using Google’s Circle to Search: Here' how
snippet: Google' Circle to Search on Android can help users identify scam text messages. By circling suspicious texts, users can quickly check if a message is fraudulent, understand warning signs and protect their personal information.

title: Motorola Signature full specifications leaked ahead of launch: here's what to expect
snippet: Motorola's new Signature lineup will launch in India on January 7, featuring a triple camera system and unique fabric finish. The specifications of the device have leaked ahead of launch, revealing a 6.8-inch AMOLED display, Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 processor, and a triple 50MP camera setup.

title: 'AI can solve problems, but humans decide what matters,’ says Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas
snippet: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas says AI can solve problems but cannot decide what matters. Speaking on a podcast, he argues that human curiosity and question framing remain beyond the reach of machines.

title: Projects under design linked incentive for semiconductors showing signs of growth
snippet: As many as 24 DLI-supported chip design projects target strategic sectors, including video surveillance, drone detection, energy metering, microprocessors, satellite communications, and IoT SoCs, according to a press release by the Press Information Bureau on Sunday.

title: Tech giants are racing to embed AI in schools around the globe
snippet: Governments worldwide are introducing generative AI in schools, partnering with US tech firms like Microsoft, OpenAI and xAI. title: Centre’s ultimatum to X; fellowships open entrepreneurial doors
snippet: Happy New Year! The Centre has pulled up X for harmful content on its website. This and more in today's ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: Mphasis chief sees discretionary tech spends accelerating
snippet: Clients are identifying pockets of their business to make it efficient through the use of AI, automating tasks that don't need as much manual effort, such as some business operations and software engineering, according to the chief executive.

title: Centre ready to revoke X's safe harbour tag to protect citizens: Govt officials

title: Fellowships open a door for campus entrepreneurs
snippet: Data from Superscout, a platform that tracks VC fellowship and scout programmes globally, shows that from a total of about 10,000 applications across such programmes, India’s participation has held steady at 12% over the past three years, up from around 7–8% in earlier cohorts (2020-2022). title: Deepinder Goyal's LAT Aerospace demonstrates ultra-short takeoff test flight
snippet: On November 13, Goyal announced that LAT’s electric unmanned aerial vehicle was almost ready for a test flight. It is expected to have a range of 60 minutes with the potential to fly between Mumbai and Pune.

snippet: Climate news hasn’t been great in 2025. Global greenhouse-gas emissions hit record highs (again). This year is set to be either the second or third warmest on record.
